summary: Email correspondence between attorneys Kathleen E. Cassidy and Susan Necheles regarding a draft submission on behalf of an unnamed client (likely Ghislaine Maxwell) to prosecutors. The emails discuss scheduling calls, delays due to the client's fragile psychological state and COVID-19 impacts, and the defense's argument for a non-prosecution disposition, portraying the client as a victim and cog in Epstein's scheme.

persons.name: Kathleen E. Cassidy
persons.context: Email correspondent involved in discussions about a submission to prosecutors on behalf of a client, coordinating call schedules and document drafts.

persons.name: Susan Necheles
persons.context: Attorney representing an unnamed client (implied to be Ghislaine Maxwell), drafting a submission to prosecutors arguing for non-prosecution, citing the client's fragile psychological state and victimhood under Epstein.

connections.description: Attorneys coordinating on a legal submission to prosecutors, exchanging drafts and scheduling calls.
Necheles is representing an unnamed client, preparing a submission to argue for non-prosecution, describing the client as psychologically fragile and a victim.

events.title: Email coordination for prosecutor submission
events.description: Attorneys Kathleen Cassidy and Susan Necheles exchange emails to schedule a call and discuss a draft submission to prosecutors on behalf of Necheles' client.

events.title: Request for call on submission status

events.title: Delay explanation due to client's state and COVID-19
events.description: Susan Necheles explains delays in drafting the submission, citing the client's emotionally fragile state, lack of therapy due to coronavirus, and reduced attorney productivity from remote work.

events.title: Draft factual statement shared
events.description: Susan Necheles shares a draft factual statement via Google Docs, arguing for a non-prosecution disposition by portraying the client as a victim and cog in Epstein's wheel.

locations: Google LLC, 1600 Amphitheatre Parkway, Mountain View, CA 94043, USA
keyFacts: The document is a series of emails from March 2020 between attorneys discussing a submission to prosecutors on behalf of an unnamed client, strongly implied to be Ghislaine Maxwell.

The defense argues for a non-prosecution disposition, portraying the client as 'a cog in Epstein's wheel, acting entirely at his direction' and as 'a very vulnerable victim' at the time of the alleged actions.
Delays in preparing the submission are attributed to the client's 'emotionally and psychologically fragile state,' inability to get proper therapy due to COVID-19, and attorneys working remotely.
Prosecutors reference a civil lawsuit filed by the client, making it difficult to explain why she can file a complaint but not make a submission to their office.
The correspondence highlights the defense strategy of emphasizing the client's victimhood and coercion by Epstein to seek a favorable legal outcome.
